About This Game

Originally released in May 2012, You Have to Win the Game has now arrived on Steam with a more difficult remixed campaign and Playable Cat DLC*!!

You Have to Win the Game is a free exploration platformer with a retro 1980s PC aesthetic.

Run, jump, and avoid deadly pitfalls as you explore the ruins of a lost world in search of hidden treasures and rare artifacts!

Experience the thrill of four-color CGA graphics and monotonic PC speaker sounds! Or take a peek at the future of home entertainment with the SIXTEEN-COLOR EGA GRAPHICS option!

Want a tougher challenge? Try YOLO mode! You only live once -- one wrong move and it's back to the start of the game!
READ MORE

Lord_Burgercraft
68 products in account
3 reviews
Recommended
15.7 hrs on record
Posted: July 20
FANTASTIC LITTLE FREE GAME

"You Have to Win the Game" is a simple, well done old-school hardcore platformer offered for the low, low price of FREE. I've gotten about 8+ hours of enjoyment out of this game so far, so it's emphatically been an incredible value. If you like games like Super Meat Boy, hell even if you don't, download this game. It's free, so what have you got to lose?!

[GOOD]
+ Plenty of presentation options. Play in the old school looking default settings, or if that doesn't tickle your fancy, set it up the way you want with the multitude of display options available. 8-bit color, 16-bit color, fullscreen, monitor border, there's a lot there.
+ Tight controls. A game like this NEEDS spot on controls, and "You Have to Win the Game" delivers. I was able to comfortably play only using the keyboard, something that's very difficult to do with other hardcore platformers.
+ Simplistic gameplay. No health bars, attacks, scores, timers, lives, map screens, inventories, etc. It's just jump past obstacles and collect the 4 powerups you need to advance in the game. Very simple, very clean.
+ Challenging. FACT: You will die a lot in this game. But if you keep at it you'll eventually move past difficult obstacles and subsequent run throughs will become easier and easier.
+ Incredible replay value. "Won" the game? Great, now try the extra spicy mode. Then try and go for 100% completion on both maps. Or beat it as a cat. Or try and beat it in under 10 minutes. Or without dying. Two maps (the original and then the remixed and more difficult 'extra spicy'), a cat mode, and YOLO mode, plus going for 100% completion, gives you a lot to do after your first go round.
+ Style is well done. YHTWTG looks and plays like it came straight out of an 80s arcade machine.
+ Good time waster. Play for 5 minutes or 50, either way you'll feel like you're advancing well enough. Can play in chunks or long sessions.
+ FREE!!!
+ Exploration. The game plays kind of like a metroidvania where there are certain places you can't get to until you get the powerup that will allow you to access it. This leads to a lot of exploring and backtracking as you collect powerups.

[NEUTRAL]
= No music. Didn't bother me at all.
= Sound effects consist of blips and bloops. True to it's nostalgic roots.

[BAD]
- Backtracking through areas can get tiresome.
- Confusing to know where you're at at times. A map feature would have been great.
- Some screens require pixel perfect placement to beat. Not for the faint of heart.
Read More

Posted: October 5
I'm not a great fan of platformers, but this game is just AWESOME!
It looks like very old game and this is 100% old-school.
Old-school graphics.
Old school sound.
Old-school difficulty level.
But don't think that there is nothing fresh here. There are so many fresh ideas. This game surprises you all the time.
And you know what? This is free!

VERDICT:
You Have to Play This Game!
